Thus, He introduced the Divine Dispositions (الأخلاق الإلهية) under the ruling of Number. So, Number has authority (سلطان) in Divine Matters (الإلهيات): in remembrance, Name, and disposition. Whoever does not stand upon this is deprived of much good from the Gnosis of Allah (المعرفة بالله). For this reason, we presented in this chapter the existence of the Units (الآحاد) within the Multiplicity (الكثرة) and the Multiplicity within the Units, which is Number. It is the one that grants benefit to those who count. <<قالُوا لَبِثْنا يَوْماً أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَسْئَلِ الْعادِّينَ>> (They said: 'We stayed a day or part of a day; ask those who count'), just as He said: <<فَسْئَلُوا أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ لا تَعْلَمُونَ>> (So ask the People of Remembrance if you do not know). Thus, He attached them to the scholars. Likewise, the Hajj is what grants the Divine Gnosis it contains to the pilgrim. For this reason, the appointed time (الميقات) was attributed to the Hajj in the crescent moon, and not attributed to the pilgrim, just as it was attributed to people [in general].

### [The Half does not imply deficiency merely by being a half]

He made them appointed times (مواقيت) for what we mentioned, for the act ends in the middle of the month, and this is completeness and perfection (تمام وكمال) in reality (في نفس الأمر). For the half does not imply deficiency (النقص) merely by being a half. If it were deficiency, then the one who attained it would be described as deficient in his attainment, because he did not attain the other half. Rather, if he attained the other half, his attainment would be a deficiency.

Allah Almighty said: "I have divided the prayer between Myself and My servant into two halves: half for Me and half for My servant."

The perfection of The Real (كمال الحق) appeared in the attainment of half of the prayer. If He were described by the attainment of the second half, it would be a deficiency in the perfection befitting Allah. And the perfection of the servant (كمال العبد) appeared in the attainment of half of the prayer. If he were described by the attainment of the other half, it would be a deficiency in the perfection of his servitude (عبوديته) and the perfection befitting him therein, for he would be described by the Attributes of the Lord (أوصاف الرب), and that is not his right.

### [Polytheism (الشرك) is among the injustices against creatures]

Do you not see how Allah does not forgive this injustice (مظلمة)—the partner (الشريك) assigned to Allah by the polytheist (المشرك)—because it pertains to the rights of others (حقوق الغير), not the right of Allah? For it is from Allah's generosity that whatever right Allah had over the servant, and the servant neglected it (فرط فيه), Allah forgives him. This is because the reality of the servant is negligence (التفريط), and nothing protects him from that except Allah. Thus, the protection (العصمة) concerning what his reality necessitates is not his; it belongs only to Allah and is in Allah's Hand. Whoever does not depart from his reality has no claim against him. For this reason, <<لله الْحُجَّةُ الْبالِغَةُ>> (Allah has the conclusive argument) against His creation.

It is thus established that polytheism (الشرك) is among the injustices against creatures (مظالم العباد). For the partner—whether a star, plant, animal, stone, or human—will come on the Day of Resurrection and say: "O Lord, ask this one who made me a god and described me with what is not befitting for me. Take my right (مظلمتي) from him." Allah will take his right from the polytheist and immortalize him in the Fire along with his partner, if the partner was a stone, plant, animal, or star. Except for the human being who did not consent to what was attributed to him, forbade it, and disliked it outwardly and inwardly; he will not be with him in the Fire. If the partner was a human who spoke and commanded [worship] and died neither a monotheist nor repentant, he will be with him in the Fire. However, for the one who did not consent to it, an image (مثال صورته) of his form will be set up for the polytheist, and he will enter the Fire with it to be tormented by it. There is no torment upon a star, stone, tree, or animal. Rather, they enter with them as an increase in their torment, so that they may see that they cannot avail them anything against Allah. <<إِنَّكُمْ وما تَعْبُدُونَ من دُونِ الله حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنْتُمْ لَها وارِدُونَ>> (Indeed, you and whatever you worship other than Allah are the fuel of Hell. You will enter it). And they will say: <<لَوْ كانَ هؤُلاءِ آلِهَةً ما وَرَدُوها>> (Had these been gods, they would not have entered it). <<وَقُودُهَا النَّاسُ والْحِجارَةُ>> (Whose fuel is men and stones). Thus, they are the embers of Hell: the men are the polytheists, and the stones are the worshipped objects.

### [Those for whom the best has preceded are kept far away from it]

As for those for whom the best has preceded (الحسنى), who neither commanded nor consented [to being worshipped], <<فهم عَنْها مُبْعَدُونَ>> (they will be kept far away from it), such as Jesus, Uzayr, and their likes, and Ali ibn Abi Talib, and everyone who was claimed to be a god while being blessed. Allah will cause their likenesses—which the polytheists used to depict in churches and elsewhere—to enter Hell with them, as a punishment for them. This is because every worshipper among the polytheists held the image (مثال صورة) of his imagined deity (معبوده المتخيلة) within himself. That imagined image will materialize (تجسد) for him, and he will enter the Fire with it, for he worshipped nothing but that image which he held within himself.

### [The materialization of meanings is not denied by the Law or by reason]

The materialization (تجسد) of imagined meanings (المعاني المتخيلة) is not denied by the Law (شرعا) or by reason (عقلا). As for reason, it is known to every imaginer. As for the Law, it has been reported that deeds (الأعمال) are given form, and deeds are accidents (أعراض). Do you not see Death (الموت), which is a relative, relational meaning (معنى نسبي إضافي)—it is the separation of the spirit from the body—yet Allah will represent it to people on the Day of Resurrection in the form of a speckled ram, which will be placed between Paradise and the Fire and slaughtered? Thus are those likenesses.

### [Nothing is worse than the injustice of the soul]

As for the one who wrongs his own soul (الظالم لنفسه) among the polytheists, his soul will demand its right (مظلمتها) from him before Allah. There is nothing worse than the injustice of the soul (ظلم النفس). Do you not see that Paradise is forbidden to the one who kills himself?

### [The perfection of a thing is that which does not remove it from its reality]

It is thus established that the perfection (الكمال) of a thing is that which does not remove it from its reality (حقيقته). If it is removed from its reality and what its Essence (ذاته) deserves, it is a deficiency (نقصا). For this reason, we said that the half is perfection (كمال) for the one whose share is the inherited wealth, even if it is divided into a third, a quarter, an eighth, two-thirds, a half, a sixth, and so on. Every portion, when attained by the rightful owner of the prescribed share (صاحب الفريضة), he has attained the perfection of his share. He is described by perfection in the share, even though he only received a sixth of the wealth, if his share was a sixth, and he is not described by deficiency.

### [And complete the Hajj and the Umrah for Allah]

Allah said: <<و أَتِمُّوا الْحَجَّ والْعُمْرَةَ لِلَّهِ>> (And complete the Hajj and the Umrah for Allah). The Umrah, without doubt, is deficient in actions compared to the actions of the Hajj, and its perfection is performing it as prescribed. Likewise, the Hajj is described by perfection when its form is fulfilled and its origination (نشأته) is completed. These are two originations (نشأتان) that the responsible servant (العبد المكلف) originates. He originates them through what Allah granted him from His creation upon the Divine Form (الصورة الإلهية), thereby giving him a share in Lordship (الربوبية) by granting him action (فعلا) and origination (إنشاء). If he is veiled by this from his servitude (عبوديته), he has become deficient, wretched, and afflicted with an ailment (علة). For this ailment, Allah made a cure, saying through the tongue of His Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him): "The injury caused by an animal (العجماء) is without liability (جبار)." Thus, He attributed the injury, which is an act, to the animal. If the servant claims Lordship (الربوبية) because he is an agent (فاعلا), he knows that he is superior to the animal. If he attributes the act to both of them, his soul is humbled, and he is cured of his ailment if he uses this remedy. Then let him reflect that the Law (الشرع) made the injury of the animal without liability, while the injury caused by a human is subject to retaliation (القصاص), even though the animal has choice (اختيار) and will (إرادة) in causing the injury. However, the animal did not intend harm to the injured party; it only intended to ward off harm from itself, and the injury and harm occurred incidentally. This is unlike the human, who may intend harm. From his animality (حيوانيته), he wards off harm, and from his humanity (إنسانيته), he intends harm.

### [Man is a structure made by a Generous, Most Generous, and Merciful Lord]

The servant is a slave (رق), and the Generous Lord (الرب الكريم) created, defining the form and detailing the parts in the whole. Then The Merciful (الرَّحْمنُ) <<خَلَقَ الْإِنْسانَ عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيانَ>> (created man, taught him clear expression), which is what the tongue utters. Then the Most Generous Lord (الرب الأكرم) <<عَلَّمَ بِالْقَلَمِ>> (taught by the pen) what the fingertip writes. Man is a structure (بنيان) made by a Generous, Most Generous, and Merciful Lord. These are four Names that directed themselves toward the creation of water, making <<من الْماءِ كُلَّ شَيْ‏ءٍ حَيٍّ>> (from water every living thing), since His Throne was upon it. The created cosmos (الكون المخلوق) is His shadow (ظله) through His shade, which He then returns to Him. The casting down (الإلقاء) is a sewing up (رتق), and the meeting (اللقاء) is a tearing open (فتق). Thus, He defined the heaven from the earth, distinguishing elevation (الرفع) from lowering (الخفض). He perfected the human craft (الصنعة الإنسانية) and dyed it with the dye of faith (الصبغة الإيمانية) in the Presence of Understanding (حضرة الفهوانية) through the witnessing of excellence (المشاهدة الإحسانية). When He wrote, He arranged, placing everything in its place and establishing its measures (أوزانه) when He set up His Balance (ميزانه).

> Every part has a ruling that distinguishes it
> In its essence forever from among its brethren.

> The Whole is multiplied by the Whole for the one who observes,
> A calculation to make understanding clear through its explanation.

> Because He arranged it in the darkness of the wombs,
> Since He was its regulator in the adjustment of its structure.

> He established its origination from the very Essence of its form,
> And the Reality of The Real (عين الحق) placed His Balance therein.

> The origin is from Me, and the ruling of the measure is from Him, thus
> The rulings of its measures manifested it in its essence.

> And He deposited the higher world (العالم العلوي) within it, through what
> He granted it from Himself, within the limit of its possibility.

> So it became a collection of what He had dispersed
> Of the Realities (الحقائق) within the Fixed Entities of its existents (أعيان أكوانه).

> Through this collection, the attainment of its form was validated;
> He would not have known that, were it not for the ruling of his faith.

> He encompassed with knowledge that the matter concerning it is
> Contrary to what is found in the verses of its Quran.

> Whoever reads it knows its reality,
> That it has never ceased to be under the ruling of its Criterion (فرقانه).

Were it not for the nobility of the soul (شرف النفس), the animal would not ward off harm from itself, nor would it intend harm to others, despite its ignorance that what is incumbent upon it from others is incumbent upon it from itself, due to the sharing of the Reality (الحقيقة). Likewise, if a human wards off harm from himself, no claim falls upon him from The Real (الحق). If he transgresses and exceeds retaliation (القصاص), or transgresses initially, he is held accountable. But he only transgresses by virtue of his humanity (إنسانا), having surpassed his animality (حيوانيته) into his humanity. The origin of this transgression is from the Origin, because the Origin possesses Self-Sufficiency (الغني). And where is its ruling compared to the ruling of <<ما خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ والْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ>> (I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me)? This command is from The Creator (الخالق)—meaning from the Name Al-Khaliq—not from the Name Al-Ghani (The Self-Sufficient). <<فَإِنْ أُحْصِرْتُمْ عن حجكم أو عمرتكم فَمَا اسْتَيْسَرَ من الْهَدْيِ>> (And if you are prevented [from completing Hajj or Umrah], then [offer] what can be obtained of sacrificial animals).

(Section on the Chapter of Prevention [الإحصار])

Scholars of remembrance (العلماء بالذكر) differed regarding the ruling of the prevented person (المحصر) in this verse, whether by illness or by an enemy, and whether this prevention (الإحصار) in this verse is by an enemy or by illness. One group said the prevention here is by an enemy. Another group said the prevention here is by illness. Others said the prevented person is one who is hindered from Hajj or Umrah by any type of hindrance, whether illness, enemy, or otherwise. This is the apparent meaning, and I hold this view, in consideration of the intention (القصد). The disagreement only arose from their understanding of the language, because the verse uses the quadriliteral form (أُحْصِرْتُمْ), and it is reported that one says *hasarahu* (حصره) the illness, and *ahsarahu* (أحصره) the enemy. Thus, in the case of illness, it is from the quadriliteral verb, and in the case of the enemy, it is from the triliteral verb.

As for the one prevented by an enemy, the majority agreed that he may exit the state of consecration (يحل) from his Umrah and Hajj immediately upon prevention (حين أحصر). Al-Thawri and Al-Hasan ibn Salih said he may not exit until the Day of Sacrifice (يوم النحر). I hold the first view: that he may exit immediately upon prevention. However, I add something here that was not seen by those who agreed with us on exiting the state of consecration immediately upon prevention: If the pilgrim (المحرم) said when entering consecration, "My place of exit is where You detain me," as commanded, then no sacrificial animal (هدي) is incumbent upon him, and he exits the state of consecration where he was prevented. If he did not say that or its equivalent, the sacrificial animal is incumbent upon him.

Those who held the view of exiting the state of consecration immediately upon prevention differed regarding the obligation of the sacrificial animal upon him, and the place of its slaughter, according to those who deem it obligatory, whether under our condition or not, concerning the Hajj or Umrah from which he was prevented. Some said no sacrificial animal is incumbent upon him, and if he had a voluntary sacrificial animal (هدي تطوع) with him, he should slaughter it where he exits the state of consecration. I hold the view of slaughtering the voluntary sacrificial animal where he exits the state of consecration. Others said the sacrificial animal is obligatory upon him. Some stipulated that the obligatory sacrificial animal must be slaughtered within the Sacred Precinct (الحرم). As for repeating the pilgrimage (الإعادة), some scholars do not see repetition as obligatory upon him, and I hold this view concerning voluntary Hajj and Umrah, if it causes him hardship (حرج). If it does not cause him hardship, he should repeat it. As for the obligatory Hajj (الفريضة), it is not waived unless he dies before repeating it, in which case Allah accepts it from him as his obligation, even if he only performed the pillar of consecration (ركن الإحرام), or even if he only had the intention (القصد) and effort (التعمل). Some said that if he entered consecration for Hajj, he must perform a Hajj and an Umrah [as a makeup]. If he was performing *qiran* (combining Hajj and Umrah), he must perform one Hajj and two Umrahs. If he was performing Umrah, he must make up his Umrah, and no shortening of the hair (تقصير) is required of him. Some who hold this view chose the shortening of the hair. Some have narrated a consensus (الإجماع) that the one prevented by illness or similar circumstances must make up the pilgrimage, but I do not know which consensus they meant. The jurists' use of the term "consensus" has exceeded its original limit to others. They may apply consensus to the agreement of two schools of thought, or to the agreement of the four schools of thought. But what is the consensus that serves as proof when the ruling is not found in the Book or in a continuously narrated Sunnah? We have mentioned the differences among them regarding this issue and omitted what is not needed at this time. Let us return to our path and say:

### [Attribution of the Act to Allah and to Man]

His saying, Almighty: <<أُحْصِرْتُمْ>> (You were prevented), is from *ahsara* (أحصر) [quadriliteral form], not *hasara* (حصر) [triliteral form]. It is said, "He did such-and-such to him," when he inflicted the action upon him. If he exposed him to the occurrence of that action, it is said *af'ala* (أفعل). An example is: Zayd *daraba* (ضرب) Amr when he inflicted the beating upon him, and Zayd *adhraba* (أضرب) Amr when he made him beat someone else. In the language, *ahsarahu* (أحصره) the illness, and *hasarahu* (حصره) the enemy (without the *alif*). Thus, in the case of illness, it is from the quadriliteral verb, and in the case of the enemy, it is from the triliteral verb.

Since the servant is the locus of the manifestation of Divine Acts (الأفعال الإلهية), and they are only witnessed sensually as proceeding from him, and it cannot be otherwise, Allah attributed the act to the servant, and people attributed the act to the creature, even though The Real (الحق) caused him to become that way (*asārahu*). Thus, *sāra* (صار - he became) attributes the act to the servant, and *asāra* (أصار - He caused him to become) attributes the act to Allah. Whoever considers *asāra* does not obligate the sacrificial animal (الهدى) upon him, because the origin is the absence of the act from the servant. Whoever considers that The Real caused him to become (*asārahu al-Haqq*) and he became (*fa-sāra*), obligates the sacrificial animal upon him. For this reason, we detailed the matter and said: If he said, "My place of exit is where You detain me," the servant has disavowed the ruling of prevention (حكم الحصر), and no sacrificial animal is incumbent upon him. If he did not say it, the sacrificial animal is incumbent upon him as a punishment for the omission (الترك).

The act proceeding from the creature to the servant is the manifestation of the act from him through choice (الاختيار), intention (القصد), and direct execution (المباشرة)—a reality witnessed by sight. And the act proceeding from the creature is due to The Real having caused him to become that way, so he is like the tool (الآلة) for the agent (الفاعل). The tool is the direct executor of the act, yet the act is attributed to something other than the tool, both visually and rationally. It is said, "Zayd is the striker," but the direct executor of the striking is the whip, not Zayd. Thus are the acts of the servants: they are like the tool for The Real, just as the tool is for Zayd the carpenter, the weaver, the tailor, or whoever he may be. To this extent, reward (الجزاء) and obligation (التكليف) are attached, due to the existence of choice (الاختيار) in the tool. The origin is the prevailing heedlessness (الغفلة الغالبة). This is a subtle issue of extreme obscurity, and there is no rational proof that removes the act from the created servant, nor has there come a text from the Lawgiver (الشارع) that does not admit interpretation.

The acts proceeding from creatures are decreed by Allah, and the existence of all their causes originates fundamentally (بالأصالة) from Allah. The servant, or any creature, has no fundamental input (مدخل) in them, except insofar as he is the locus of their manifestation (مظهر لها). The term *muzhir* (locus of manifestation) is both an active participle and a passive participle. It is said concerning a craftsman, if something goes wrong in his craft due to the tool not cooperating, despite his knowledge of the craft: "He failed in such-and-such," or he is asked, "Why did you fail, knowing that we know you are skilled?" He replies, "The tool did not help me manifest what was in my knowledge." And the object made (المصنوع) says, "I did not fall short, due to the manifestation of my essence, not due to the intention of the maker." Thus, from the perspective of the craft in the object made, nothing went wrong. But from the perspective of the object made, nothing other than it was intended. If the maker is a creature, there is a flaw. But if the Maker is The Creator (الخالق), nothing in the craft is flawed, because everything is intended, due to the non-deficiency of the attachment of the Will (الإرادة). Everything that occurs and does not occur is willed by The Real (مراد للحق). Allah willed the existence of a certain accident (عرض) but did not will the existence of a locus (محل) for this accident to subsist in. Yet, the existence of that accident was impossible unless the locus existed. Therefore, the existence of the locus is necessary, since the existence of the accident was necessary. The existence of the accident proceeds from a voluntary creation (إيجاد اختياري), and the existence of the locus proceeds from a non-voluntary creation (إيجاد غير اختياري). It is not permissible for it to be compulsory (اضطرار يا), since the existence of that accident was necessary. Thus, the compulsion (اضطرار) of the cosmos (الكون) arises from the reality of the absence of this realized choice. So, pay attention.

### [The World emerged upon the Form of The Real]

If you do not know things from the perspective of their realities (حقائقها), you will not know that the World (العالم) emerged upon the Form of The Real (صورة الحق), such that the realities within it are linked to the Divine Realities (الحقائق الإلهية). This is a difficult perception, upon which are many veils that are not lifted by thought (فكر) or by Unveiling (كشف). The matter revolves between the influence of The Real (حق) upon creation (خلق) and the influence of creation upon The Real. Allah Almighty said: <<أُجِيبُ دَعْوَةَ الدَّاعِ إِذا دَعانِ>> (I answer the call of the caller when he calls upon Me). And He said: <<ذلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ اتَّبَعُوا ما أَسْخَطَ الله>> (That is because they followed what angered Allah). So, the she-camel has a drink—I mean the she-camel of Salih—and <<لَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٌ>> (And for you is the drink of a known day). He struck a parable for a people who understand. <<وما مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقامٌ مَعْلُومٌ>> (And there is none among us except that he has a known station). Thus, prevention (الحصر) encompasses Existence (الوجود). Every existent thing is described by some prevention, and is thus prevented from that aspect. I have made clear to you what neither Unveiling nor theoretical rational proof can repel. <<والله يَقُولُ الْحَقَّ وهُوَ يَهْدِي السَّبِيلَ>> (And Allah speaks The Truth, and He guides to the way).

(Section on the Rulings on Killing Game in the Sacred Precinct and in the State of Consecration)

A part of the ruling concerning game (الصيد) has already preceded in this chapter. The discussion here concerns killing it, not hunting it, whether in the Sacred Precinct (الحرم) or outside it, due to His saying: <<لا تَقْتُلُوا الصَّيْدَ وأَنْتُمْ حُرُمٌ>> (Do not kill game while you are in the state of consecration). This verse is decisive (محكمة). They differed regarding its details according to their understanding of it. Among these differences is whether the obligation is its value (قيمته) or its equivalent (مثله). Some held that the obligation is the equivalent, while others said one is given the choice between the value and the equivalent.

### [Killing Game in the Sacred Precinct or in the State of Consecration is a Martyrdom for the Game]

Killing game (الصيد) is a martyrdom (شهادة) for the game, so it is alive and provided for, because it was killed by transgression (تعديا) unjustly in the way of Allah, since the way of Allah is its sacredness (حرمه). The sacredness is the attribute of the consecrated person (المحرم) and the place (البقعة). This game, upon which transgression occurred, is either due to these two attributes or one of them. Whoever intentionally kills it while consecrated or in the Sacred Precinct has transgressed against it. Thus, the death intended for it returns [to the killer], even if it is not inflicted upon the killer: <<فَمَنِ اعْتَدى‏ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاعْتَدُوا عَلَيْهِ بِمِثْلِ ما اعْتَدى‏ عَلَيْكُمْ>> (So whoever transgresses against you, transgress against him to the same extent that he transgressed against you). The game is killed (*maqtūl*), not dead (*mayyit*), and the killer is dead (*mayyit*), not killed (*maqtūl*). This is the responsible dead person (الميت المكلف), just as the dead person in his grave is asked for an answer during the questioning, despite being described as dead. This is the spiritual death (الموت المعنوي). He is obligated to an expiation (جزاء): <<مِثْلُ ما قَتَلَ من النَّعَمِ ... هَدْياً بالِغَ الْكَعْبَةِ أَوْ كَفَّارَةٌ طَعامُ مَساكِينَ أَوْ عَدْلُ ذلِكَ صِياماً لِيَذُوقَ وَبالَ أَمْرِهِ>> (An equivalent of the game he killed among the grazing livestock... as an offering reaching the Kaaba, or an expiation of feeding needy people, or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his deed). Just as the dead person is tormented in his grave. Whoever repeats such an act, <<فَيَنْتَقِمُ الله مِنْهُ>> (Allah will take retribution from him), either by repeating the expiation, for it is a consequence (*wabāl*), and the consequence is retribution, or by waiving this specific consequence in the world and taking retribution from him through an affliction (مصيبة) He tests him with, either in this world or the Hereafter, for it is not specified.

### [Sciences of the Secrets Guarded from Others]

Know that every science (علم) among the sciences of the secrets guarded (الأسرار المصونة) in the treasuries of Divine Jealousy (خزائن الغيرة), which is only granted to its people, is like the saying of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him): "Do not give wisdom (الحكمة) to those who are not worthy of it, lest you wrong it." It is like game (الصيد) in the sanctuary of the Sacred Precinct (الحرم) or the state of consecration (الإحرام), or both—meaning in both sanctuaries. If one kills it—which means granting it to those who are not worthy, so they do not know its value, and it dies with them—its consequence (وبالها) returns upon him, and he becomes an unbeliever (*yakfur*) and a heretic (*yazandaq*) because of it. That is the very expiation (عين الجزاء) ruled by two just witnesses: the Book and the Sunnah.

If the expiation is an equivalent (مثلا), one searches for an ignorant person (جاهل) who possesses wisdom but does not know its value. One then explains its status to him until his heart is revived by it. Then, that person intentionally kills the very essence of the ignorance (عين الجهل) subsisting in him, which was the cause of the loss of this knowledge with him. The form of the punishment and consequence upon him is that he is deprived of the wisdom of that ignorance in that ignorant person, until he sees it as a blameworthy attribute, forbidden, and sought refuge from Allah against, in His saying: <<أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ أَنْ أَكُونَ من الْجاهِلِينَ>> (I seek refuge in Allah from being among the ignorant). Thus, he is deprived of what is perfection in reality (كمال في نفس الأمر), since ignorance (الجهل) is among the secrets stored in the Fixed Entities (أعيان) of the ignorant. The preservation of these secrets is the scholars' aversion to them. It is as if they disavowed their own realities (حقائقهم). What they disavowed, they fell into, for they disavowed ignorance through ignorance, had they understood it. The ruling of their ignorance within them is greater than the ignorance of the truly ignorant, for they did not pay attention to Allah's saying: <<فَلا تَكُونَنَّ من الْجاهِلِينَ>> (So do not be among the ignorant). One only refrains from something known and verified by him. If he does not know ignorance, he does not know what he is forbidden from. If he knows it, he has been characterized by it. If ignorance is not a direct experience (ذوقا), he cannot attain knowledge of it, for it is among the sciences of direct experiences (علوم الأذواق).

### [Knowledge of Allah is the Essence of Ignorance of Him]

Do you not see that the group (الطائفة) has agreed that Knowledge of Allah (العلم بالله) is the very Essence of Ignorance of Him (عين الجهل به)? And Allah Almighty said concerning the ignorant: <<ذلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُمْ من الْعِلْمِ>> (That is the extent of their knowledge). Thus, He called ignorance knowledge for the one who pays attention. It is a fundamental existential attribute (صفة كيانية حقيقة) for the servant: if he departs from it, he is blamed, and if he remains in it, he is praised. For he knows nothing of Allah except what he possesses, and what he possesses is finite, for it is *with* him. But what He is—He—is infinite, and that He is—He—is the very Essence of Ignorance (عين الجهل). And what is with him is the very Essence of Knowledge (عين العلم). Thus, He is the very Essence of the indication and the proof, and He is the indicator, so He is the very Essence of Knowledge of Allah.

> Knowledge of Allah is the negation of knowledge of Allah,
> And certainty is from the attribute of the one described as heedless (الساهي).

> So knowledge is ignorance because the Essence (العين) is one,
> And ignorance is knowledge because Allah is in the Hidden (اللاهي).

End of Part Sixty-Nine.

(In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful)

(Section on the Chapter of their difference regarding the verse on killing game in the Sacred Precinct and the state of consecration: Is its expiation sequential or optional?)

The verse is His saying: <<فَجَزاءٌ مِثْلُ ما قَتَلَ من النَّعَمِ>> (The recompense is an equivalent of the game he killed among the grazing livestock) to the end of the verse. They differed regarding whether this verse implies sequence (الترتيب) or choice (التخيير). Some held that it implies sequence: first the equivalent, if not possible, then feeding, if not possible, then fasting. Others held that the verse implies choice, meaning the person liable for the expiation is given a choice between the three rulings. I hold this view, for the word "or" (أو) necessitates choice. Had sequence been intended, He would have said "and" and clarified, as He did in expiations requiring sequence: "and whoever does not find..." Our school of thought (مذهبنا) regarding this issue is that the equivalent (المثل) mentioned here is not what some understood—that a camel (بدنة) should be given for an ostrich, a sheep (شاة) for a gazelle, and a domestic cow for a wild cow. Rather, for every thing, its equivalent is required. If it was an ostrich, he buys an ostrich hunted by a non-consecrated person (حلال) in a non-sacred area (حل). Likewise, for every named game whose hunting and eating is lawful, whether bird or quadruped. Or, an expiation (كفارة) by feeding. The limit of this, in my view, is that one looks at the value (قيمة) of that equivalent, buys food with that value, and feeds it to the needy (المساكين). Or, the equivalent of that in fasting (صياما). We look at the expiations most similar to this expiation, which combines a sacrificial animal (هدي), feeding, or fasting. We found none except the one who shaves his head while consecrated due to harm that afflicted him: <<فَفِدْيَةٌ من صِيامٍ أَوْ صَدَقَةٍ أَوْ نُسُكٍ>> (The ransom is a fast, or charity, or a sacrifice). He mentioned the three things mentioned in the expiation for killing game. The Lawgiver (الشارع) stipulated there that the feeding is six needy people, with half a *sa'* for each needy person, and the fasting is three days, making one day for every *sa'*. We look at the value: if it reaches one *sa'* or less, then one day, for fasting is indivisible. If the value is enough to buy two *sa'*s, or less than two *sa'*s, or more than one *sa'*, then two days, and so on, according to the value reached. By "value," I mean the value of the equivalent, with which food is bought and fed. The fasting is based on the amount of food obtained by purchase, as we established. Thus, he is given the choice between the equivalent, feeding with the value of the equivalent, and fasting according to the amount of food obtained from the value of the equivalent. The consumption of the equivalent and the food is a cause for the continuation of life for the one nourished by it, because the transgressor destroyed a soul and removed life. He compensates for this and expiates it with something that causes the continuation of life. It is as if he revived it for the duration of its subsistence through the attainment of that nourishment from the equivalent or the food.

### [Fasting is a Divine Attribute]

As for fasting (الصيام), it is a Divine Attribute (صفة ربانية). The killer is obligated to perform it if he does not expiate with the equivalent or the feeding. If you refuse, then exit the state of restriction (التحجير) so that the killer of the game is not restricted, and thus nothing is obligated upon him. He asked, "And what is that?" He said, "Fasting, for it is Mine, and I am not characterized by restriction upon Me. So, clothe yourself in My Attribute, and you will attain protection in the sanctuary from restriction upon you." When you fast, the fasting is for Me, and the hunger is for you. The hunger in the fasting, which pertains to your right and not Mine, becomes an expiation, because hunger is one of the causes that remove life from the living being, thus resembling killing, which is a cause that removes life from the living being. Yet, your life is not removed by this hunger, because it is the hunger of fasting, and fasting is one of My Attributes, which does not affect Eternal Life. For this reason, it is not considered the hunger of destruction.

### [The Real removes things, not annihilates them]

The Real (الحق), Glory be to Him, is the remover of things (*mudhhib*), not their annihilator (*mu'dim*), because He is an Agent (فاعل), and an Agent is one who acts upon something. Non-thing (لا شي‏ء) cannot be acted upon. Even if He removes things from one location, they have existence in another location. The cosmos (الكون), which involves gathering and separation, does not indicate the non-existence of the Fixed Entities (الأعيان). Death is removal (إذهاب), not annihilation (إعدام), for it is a transition from the world (dunya) to the Hereafter, the first stage of which is the Isthmus (البرزخ). Since removal (الإذهاب) is one of the Attributes of The Real, not annihilation (الإعدام), as He said: <<إِنْ يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ ويَأْتِ بِآخَرِينَ>> (If He wills, He can remove you, O mankind, and bring others), and He did not say "annihilate you," for this reason, the hunger of fasting was not made the hunger of soul destruction, even though it is removal, not annihilation. This is because annihilation is not valid for this existent thing, for the one characterized by Existence (الوجود) is only The Real (الحق) manifesting in the Fixed Entities of the Manifestations (أعيان المظاهر). Non-existence (العدم) does not attach to Him fundamentally, for He says to a thing when He wills it: <<كُنْ فَيَكُونُ>> (Be, and it is).

### [The Real is the Manifesting in the Fixed Entities of the Manifestations]

> I looked into the cosmos of the One Whose Will said,
> When directed toward things, "Be," and it is.

> When I realized the Essence of its being,
> Behold, it was His Essence, none other, so I am.

> So take, may I be your ransom, a knowledge you were ignorant of,
> And look at how the most difficult of things becomes easy.

> For knowledge is the noblest description attained by a human,
> And the possessor of knowledge is guarded and protected.

> If he stands, he stands by it; if he departs, he departs with it,
> While state and wealth are subject to vanishing.

> The composer of this is none other than Him, so to Him belongs
> What I said, for He is the One in the Essence (عين) of every constituted thing.

> Were it not for His Theophany (تجلي) in the Fixed Entities (الأعيان), the descriptions
> Of "He was," "He is," and "He will be" would not have appeared through Him.

> Therefore, He is named by Time (Dahr) that has no end
> And no beginning, so the form of the cosmos is from His "Be-ing" (*kunūn*).

(Section on the Chapter of Whether the Game or the Equivalent is Required)

Our school of thought (مذهبنا) has already established that the equivalent (المثل) is required, and we clarified what the equivalent is. Some said the game itself is required. Others said the equivalent is required, which is our view, though we differed with them on what the equivalent is. Likewise, they differed on the estimation of fasting (الصيام) by food. Our school of thought on this has preceded. One group said one day for every *mudd*. Others said one day for every two *mudds*.

(Section on the Chapter of Killing Game by Mistake)

They differed. Some said expiation (الجزاء) is required, and others said nothing is incumbent upon him. I hold the latter view, for killing by mistake (قتل الخطاء) is the killing of Allah, and there is no ruling against Allah. For, relative to Allah, the killing is intended (مقصود), but relative to us, it is a mistake, due to the manifestation of the killing through our hands and the absence of intention in it. The killed thing is intended—meaning intended for killing—but not intended by the killer. For this reason, the disagreement arose, due to the application of the two rulings concerning it. Whoever considers that he killed it by virtue of his manifestation in the locus of the killer did not obligate expiation, because that Fixed Entity (العين) in which he manifested granted him the ruling that there is no expiation, because He (Allah) is the one intending the killing. Whoever considers that the killer is the one behind the veil of the manifest cosmos, but that the act was not inflicted and manifested in existence by the hand of the manifest one, obligated expiation, because the ruling is manifest, while the intention is unseen, and we are not obligated by the unseen. If the killer knows within himself that he killed unintentionally, and the apparent Law (ظاهر الشرع) obligates expiation upon him through the two rulings, this expiation is a voluntary charity (صدقة تطوع) for him, with a legal obligation based on a principle unknown to the judge. Thus, this killer combines the reward of the voluntary act and the obligatory act, and what the obligatory and voluntary acts waive is waived for him simultaneously. If no one saw him, he proceeds, and nothing is incumbent upon him.

(Section on the Chapter of the Group of Consecrated People Participating in Killing Game)

They differed when a group of consecrated people (محرمون) participated in killing game. Some said an expiation is incumbent upon each one, and others said one expiation is incumbent upon them collectively. What I hold is that if each of the partners knew that he struck it in a lethal spot, an expiation is incumbent upon everyone who struck it in a lethal spot. Whoever wounded it in a non-lethal spot has no expiation upon him, though he is sinful (آثم) for exposing himself to harm concerning what was forbidden to him. The group here is sinful, since a person sins with all eight of his obligated limbs, so he owes a repentance (توبة) for each limb from the perspective of that limb. Whoever views repentance as being from the side of the One repented to, not from the thing repented from, is the one who holds the view of a single expiation. Some differentiated between consecrated people killing game and non-consecrated people killing game in the Sacred Precinct. They said that for the consecrated people, an expiation is incumbent upon each one, and for the non-consecrated people, a single expiation.

(Section on the Chapter of Whether one of the two judges can be the killer of the game)

Some held that it is not permissible, and others permitted it. Whoever holds that there is no agent (فاعل) but Allah, and He is the Judge and the Agent, permitted it. Whoever holds that the act belongs to the creature did not permit it. I hold the first view, and I affirm the second view, but not in the manner believed by those who hold it.

(Section on the Chapter of their difference regarding the place of feeding)

Some said he should feed [the poor] in the place where the game was killed, if there is food there, or in the nearest place to it if there is no food there. Others said wherever he feeds, it suffices. I hold this view, because Allah did not specify [a place]. Some said he must only feed the needy of Mecca. Whoever takes Allah as his direction (قبلته) did not specify the feeding to a particular place, but whoever takes the House (البيت) as his direction specified it.

(Section on the Chapter of their difference regarding the non-consecrated person killing game in the Sacred Precinct, after their consensus that the consecrated person who kills game must pay expiation)

Some said expiation is incumbent upon him. Others said nothing is incumbent upon him. I hold the latter view.

(Section on the Chapter of the consecrated person killing game and eating it)

Some said one expiation is incumbent upon him, and I hold this view. It was said two expiations are incumbent upon him, and this was the view of Ata'. There is a perspective on this with me, for the Law considered it, and only permitted its eating for one who did not assist in it in any way. How much more so if he is the killer? His eating of it forbids his hunting of it, just as his killing of it was forbidden. These are three prohibitions: hunting, killing, and eating.

### [It is the right of his soul upon him that he should only feed it what it has a right to]

Since the eater strives for his soul, and it is the right of his soul upon him that he should only feed it what it has a right to, if he feeds it what it has no right to, he has wronged it (ظلمها). Thus, he is recompensed with the recompense of one who wrongs his own soul.

(Section on the Chapter of Ransom for Harm [فدية الأذى])

Scholars agreed that it is obligatory upon one who removes harm (الأذى) out of necessity. This is the obligation of the curse upon those who harm Allah and His Messenger. Thus, warding off harm was obligatory out of respect for the consecrated person (المحرم), and expiation (الكفارة) was obligatory out of respect for the state of consecration (الإحرام).

### [Speaking about Allah in a manner that is not befitting is harm, so removing it was obligatory]

Speaking about Allah in a manner that is not befitting is harm (أذى), so removing it was obligatory out of respect for The Real (الحق). Since there is no agent (فاعل) but Allah, expiation (الكفارة) was obligatory, which is the concealment (الستر) of this attribution, so that such an act is not attributed to Allah, the Exalted and Glorious. All expiations are concealment, wherever they occur. They differed regarding one who removes harm without necessity. Some said the stipulated ransom (الفدية المنصوص عليها) is incumbent upon him. Others said a sacrificial animal (دم) is incumbent upon him. I hold the latter view, for he is not harmed in himself—meaning he is not in pain because of it. For this reason, the locus of harm was made the head, which is sensed, and not the hair. Thus, there is no necessity that mandates shaving.

### [Man is created upon the Form]

Since man was created upon the Form (الصورة), removing harm from him was obligatory due to the attribution, as a care for him. And expiation was obligatory concerning what Allah obligated him to do or permitted him to do, lest the sensation of harm distract him from the remembrance of Allah. The Hajj was only legislated for the remembrance of Allah. Thus, expiation was obligatory when he did not endure the harm, for he did not fulfill the right of the Form (الصورة). It is reported that "No one is more patient in the face of harm than Allah." By this, He is named The Patient (الصبور), and by not taking retribution despite having the power, He is named The Forbearing (الحليم).

(Section on the Chapter of their difference regarding whether intentionality is a condition for the one upon whom the ransom is obligatory for removing harm)

They differed as to whether it is a condition for the one upon whom the ransom (الفدية) is obligatory for removing harm that he be intentional (متعمدا), or whether the forgetful (الناسي) and the intentional are the same. Some said they are the same. Others said there is no ransom upon the forgetful. I hold the latter view. The forgetful person here is one who forgets his state of consecration (إحرامه). Both are intentional in removing the harm. If the ransom is obligatory upon the compelled person (المضطر)—who intended to remove it to eliminate the harm while remembering his state of consecration—then it is even more obligatory upon the forgetful person, because he was commanded with the remembrance specific to the state of consecration. If he forgot the state of consecration, he did not bring the remembrance required of the consecrated person. Thus, removing the harm and forgetting the state of consecration combined upon him, making the expiation more obligatory.

### [Attribution of Acts: to Allah, or to the servants, or to both in two different respects]

The foundation upon which this chapter and all acts of worship should rest is the knowledge of the attribution of acts (إضافة الأفعال): Are they attributed *to* Allah and *to* the servants, or *from* Allah and *from* the servants? For their existence is verified, but their attribution is not verified. Let us first state a principle concerning this: if you verify it and look at it with the eye of an impartial observer, you will know it or come close. I will detail it but will not specify the matter as it is in itself, due to the harm involved and the disagreement among people concerning it. The disagreement will not be lifted from the world by my statement, so keeping it ambiguous in general is preferable. The scholars among our men will understand what I allude to in it. I say that Allah has said that He did not create creation except by The Real (بالحق). People have spoken about this Reality by which creation was made, but no one has explicitly stated what it is; they have only alluded to probable matters.

### [The Reality by which creation was made and the created World are two verified matters]

Know that The Reality by which creation was made (الحق المخلوق به) and the created World (العالم المخلوق) are two verified matters, agreed upon by all, except that they are analogous to the Hylé Substance (الجوهر الهبائي) and the Form (الصورة). It is known among the community that acts proceed from the Form. But who is the Form? Is it the World, or is it The Reality by which creation was made, concerning which Allah said: <<ما خَلَقْناهُما إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ>> (We did not create them except with The Reality), and <<وبِالْحَقِّ أَنْزَلْناهُ وبِالْحَقِّ نَزَلَ>> (And with The Reality We sent it down, and with The Reality it descended)? Whoever holds that The Reality by which creation was made is the locus of manifestation (مظهر) for the forms of the World attributes the acts to creation (الخلق), as they appear in it according to what the realities of the forms grant, based on their differences. Whoever holds that the Fixed Entities of the possibles (أعيان الممكنات), which constitute the World, are the Hylé Substance (الجوهر الهبائي), and that The Reality by which creation was made is the Form (الصورة) in this World—and the shapes of its forms diversified due to the differences in the Fixed Entities of the World, leading to different descriptions and titles for Him, just as the Divine Names are attributed based on the difference of their effects in the World—whoever holds this attributes the act to Allah in the form of the manifest Form. Whoever holds that the manifestation of the Form is only possible in the Hylé Substance, and that Existence (الوجود) is not valid for the Hylé Substance in its essence except through the attainment of the Form, so the Form is not known except through the Hylé Substance, and the Hylé Substance does not exist except through the Form—he attributes the acts to Allah in one respect and to the servants in another respect. Thus, he attaches praises and goodness to the acts attributed to The Real (الحق), and he attaches blame and ugliness to the acts attributed to the servants (العباد) through creation (الخلق), which is the World, due to the ruling of rational participation and the suspension of knowledge concerning each one of them, and the dependence of the perfection of Existence upon their existence. I have set you upon the clear path.

### [And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw]

This is the interpretation of <<و ما رَمَيْتَ إِذْ رَمَيْتَ ولكِنَّ الله رَمى>> (And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw). He negated the throwing from the one to whom He affirmed it. Allah states in this verse the very thing we have said and adopted concerning this issue. <<والله يَقُولُ الْحَقَّ وهُوَ يَهْدِي السَّبِيلَ>> (And Allah speaks The Truth, and He guides to the way)—meaning He clarifies it so that we may walk upon it. <<ما من دَابَّةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ آخِذٌ بِناصِيَتِها إِنَّ رَبِّي عَلى‏ صِراطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ>> (There is no creature except that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a straight path). So, we walked upon it, by the praise of Allah. Thus, He established by this verse that the Fixed Entities (أعيان) of the World are the Hylé Substance (الجوهر الهبائي), except that it does not exist except through the existence of the Form (الصورة). Likewise, the Fixed Entities of the World were only characterized by Existence (الوجود) through the manifestation of The Real (الحق) within them. Thus, The Reality by which creation was made is like the Form for them. I have informed you that the entirety of the act only appears to proceed from the Form, and He is the One Who said: <<ولكِنَّ الله رَمى>> (But Allah threw). Thus, The Real was the very Essence of the Form from which the acts are witnessed. So, verify what we have mentioned, for there is nothing clearer than what Allah clarified in this verse, and what we clarified in our detailed commentary upon it. <<والله يَهْدِي من يَشاءُ إِلى‏ صِراطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ>> (And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path)—the Path of Allah (صِراطِ الله), the Path upon which the Lord is, and the Path attributed to the Reality in His saying: <<وأَنَّ هذا صِراطِي مُسْتَقِيماً>> (And that this is My straight path). Each path has a ruling that the other does not possess, so understand. And as for <<صِراطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ>> (The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor), that is the Law (الشرع).

(Section on the Chapter of their difference regarding the timing of feeding and fasting)

They differed regarding the timing of the feeding and fasting. The majority hold that one should feed six needy people. Others said ten needy people and ten days of fasting. They differed on how much to feed each needy person. Some said two *mudds* by the *mudd* of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) for each needy person. Others said half a *sa'* of wheat, and one *sa'* of dates, raisins, and barley. As for clipping the nails (قص الأظفار), some said there is nothing required for it. Others said a sacrificial animal (دم) is required. The branches of this chapter are very numerous.

### [What the Presences of Attributes are fed from the Cosmic Presences]

Whoever considered the six needy people looked at what the Attributes (الصفات) are fed of what they demand. He found them to be six cosmic [attributes] (كونية) corresponding to six Divine [Attributes] (إلهية). The cosmic attributes have the same ruling as the Divine attributes. Feeding them is giving them what they demand for the continuation of their reality, for it is like nourishment for natural bodies. The known thing is the food for Knowledge (العلم), to which it relates. Likewise, Will (الإرادة), Power (القدرة), Speech (الكلام), Hearing (السمع), and Sight (البصر). As for Life (الحياة), it has no entry into this chapter; its ultimate reality is merely conditional, and that is another chapter.

### [The End of the Simple Numbers that encompass the Two Presences]

Since the Presence (الحضرة) consists of two Presences, the total is twelve, which is the end of the names of the simple numbers (بسائط العدد) that encompass the two Presences, for Number enters upon both of them. For this reason, the multiplicity of Attributes (الصفات) and Names attributed to Allah has been reported. As for its ruling in the cosmos (الكون), no one can deny it. It is also the ultimate end of the measure of the verb (وزن الفعل), which is composed of one hundred and eighty degrees. I will clarify its ruling, if Allah wills.

### [The Twelve Measures of the Verb in the Names]

As for the measures of the verb (أوزان الفعل) in the Names, they are twelve measures, each measure demanding what the others do not. They are confined to this number, just as the end of the names of the numbers is confined to Twelve. Among these are three for the quiescence (*taskīn*) of the middle radical (*ayn*), three for its opening (*fatha*), three for its closing (*damma*), and three for its breaking (*kasra*). The total is twelve. The quiescence examples are *fa'l* (فعل) like *Da'd* (دعد), *fu'l* (فعل) like *qufl* (قفل), and *fi'l* (فعل) like *Hind* (هند). The open middle radical examples are *fa'al* (فعل) like *jamal* (جمل), *fu'al* (فعل) like *surad* (صرد), and *fi'al* (فعل) like *inab* (عنب). The closed middle radical examples are *fa'ul* (فعل) like *adud* (عضد), *fu'ul* (فعل) like *unuq* (عنق), and *fi'ul* (فعل)—no word of this measure is found in the language. The specialists in this field rationalized this by saying they found it difficult to move from the breaking (*kasra*) to the closing (*damma*). Their discussion is based on ease of pronunciation. This rationale is nothing, in our view, as we elaborated in the first version of this book. We did come across an Arabic word on the measure *fi'ul* (فعل)—with the *fa'* broken and the *ayn* closed—but I do not recall it now, except that it is a rare dialect. The broken middle radical examples are *fa'il* (فعل) like *katif* (كتف), and *fu'il* (فعل) like *ibil* (إبل). No word is found on the measure *fi'il* (فعل) except *Di'il* (دئل), which is the name of a small animal known to the Arabs.

### [The Total of Letters that are Roots in the Measures of Speech among the Arabs]

Furthermore, Allah executed His Wisdom in His creation that the Arabs should only use these three letters—the *Fa*, the *Ayn*, and the *Lam*—in the measures of speech. These have three levels (مراتب) in origination (النشأة). They took one letter from each level: they took the *Fa* from the lip letters, representing the World of Dominion and Witnessing (عالم الملك والشهادة); they took the *Ayn* from the throat letters, representing the World of the Unseen and the Malakūt (عالم الغيب والملكوت); and they took the *Lam* from the middle, representing the World of the Isthmus and the Jabarūt (عالم البرزخ والجبروت), which is from the letters of the tongue, which possesses expression and control over speech. The total of these letters, which they made the roots in the measures of speech, is one hundred and eighty degrees. This is half of the manifest celestial sphere (الفلك الظاهر), which always has an effect in formation (التكوين). The unseen half has no effect except where it manifests.

### [The Establishment of the Fixed Entities of the Possibles in their State of Non-Existence]

The reason for this is that the rays of the lights of the stars connect with the elemental locus (المحل العنصري), which is the place where their rays fall. The elements are receptive to formation (التكوين) within them. When the rays connect with them, putrefaction (التعفين) quickly occurs in them, due to the heat in the lights and the moisture in the element of water and air. Thus, the Fixed Entities of the constituted things (أعيان المكونات) appear. Indeed, Allah fermented the clay of Adam with His Hand, and fermentation (التخمير) is putrefaction. What is absent from these lights has no effect in it. Do you not see that if a solar eclipse occurs at night, it has no ruling with us, due to the absence of witnessing the manifest surface of the Earth's sphere upon which we are? Thus, it has no ruling except where it manifests, by the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing. For where it manifests, it witnesses what is present with it, and thus affects it due to its witnessing, by a natural custom established by Allah. This is the clearest proof for the Mu'tazilite view regarding the establishment of the Fixed Entities of the possibles (أعيان الممكنات) in their state of non-existence (عدمها), and that they possess thingness (*shay'iyya*). This is His saying, Almighty: <<إِنَّما قَوْلُنا لِشَيْ‏ءٍ إِذا أَرَدْناهُ أَنْ نَقُولَ لَهُ كُنْ>> (Our word to a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say to it, "Be"). So, He sees us, Glory be to Him, in our state of non-existence, in the thingness of our establishment, just as He sees us in our state of existence. This is because there is no unseen (غيب) concerning Him, Almighty. Every state is a witnessing (شهادة) for Him. The possessor of witnessing knows this. He, Almighty, discloses Himself (يتجلى) to the things He wills to bring into existence, in their state of non-existence, through His Name The Light (النور). The lights of this Theophany (التجلي) then burst forth upon those Fixed Entities (الأعيان), and they become prepared by it to accept existence, like the preparation of the fetus in its mother's womb in the fourth month of gestation for the blowing of the spirit into it. At this state of preparation, He says to it, "Be," and it is immediately, without delay. Look at how clear this wisdom is!

### [The Principles are Always Observed]

Furthermore, it is part of the perfection of Wisdom (الحكمة) that if among the recipients of formation there is one who cannot accept it due to a reality upon which he stands, except by increasing the degrees between his origin (أصله) and his reality (حقيقته), then the *lām* of that weight (وزن) is repeated, provided the letters of the weight are from the word itself and its roots. For example, the word *Ja‘far* (جعفر) has the weight *fa‘lal* (فعلل), so one of the root letters is repeated because all the letters of the weighed word are roots. If a letter in the word is extraneous, we bring it in its form and do not assign it a letter from the letters of the verb [root]. Thus, we say the weight of *maksab* (مكسب) is *maf‘al* (مفعل). The roots (الأصول) are always what are observed in things, and they are what produce the effects therein. Some have said:

The noble steeds run according to their origins (أعراقها)
Meaning, according to their roots. Therefore, whoever has a noble origin must be affected by that origin. If baseness appears from him, it is an accidental matter (أمر عارض) that will eventually return to its origin. The same applies to one of base origin. This is a matter few people realize: why do the origins of contingent beings (الممكنات) return? Is their origin noble, meaning the Necessary Being (واجب الوجود) is their origin, or is their origin base, meaning contingency (الإمكان)? In the latter case, poverty, wretchedness, and baseness will always accompany them, and any praiseworthy qualities attributed to them would be accidental. Herein lie secrets and subtleties (أسرار ودقائق). We entrust you to yourself in discerning them, for their general manifestation is difficult. We have left the knowledge of this to whomever Allah informs, so that he may grasp the reality of the matter in itself. There remains a small portion of the fundamental issues of this chapter, the consideration of which we shall mention in the sequence of the traditions related to this chapter, if Allah wills. End of Part Seventy.

<<بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم>>

(A Section on the Chapters of Prophetic Traditions Related to This Chapter)

I will not mention them in their entirety, but only those that are necessary. Having mentioned the proof of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, from the Hadith of Jabir ibn Abdullah, let us mention in the remainder of this chapter what is available of the Prophetic narrations. Among these is:

(The Hadith on the Virtue of Hajj and Umrah)

Muslim recorded in his *Ṣaḥīḥ* from Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Umrah to Umrah is an expiation (كفارة) for what is between them, and Hajj Mabrur (الحج المبرور) has no reward but Paradise."

[Expiation Grants Concealment, and Paradise Grants Concealment]

Expiation (الكفارة) grants concealment (الستر), and Paradise (الجنة) grants concealment. However, the concealment of Umrah is only effective between two Umrahs, whereas the concealment of Hajj is not conditioned by that, except that it is restricted to being *mabrūr* (pious/righteous). *Al-Birr* (Piety) is *Al-Iḥsān* (Spiritual Excellence), and *Al-Iḥsān* is witnessing (مشاهدة) or being as if one is witnessing. For he, peace and blessings be upon him, said in the interpretation of *Al-Iḥsān*: "That you worship Allah as if you see Him."

Thus, Paradise results from a Hajj qualified by the attribute of *birr*. The *birr* stands for Hajj in the place of the second Umrah for the first Umrah. The reason for this is that expiation (التكفير) and Paradise are results (نتيجة), and a result cannot arise from a single premise, for that is invalid. Rather, it must arise from two premises. Thus, expiation is achieved through two Umrahs, and Paradise is achieved through a Hajj *mabrūr*, meaning it proceeds from one who possesses the attribute of *birr*. How wondrous are the intentions of the Lawgiver!

[The Visitations of the People of Felicity to The Real]

Umrah is a visitation (الزيارة). It is the visitations of the people of felicity (أهل السعادة) to Allah here [in this world] by means of hearts and deeds, and in the Hereafter by means of essences (الذوات) and entities (الأعيان). Between the visitations are veils (حجب) and hindrances between the visitors and their people among the inhabitants of the Gardens, and in the state of the world, between those performing Umrah and others. Thus, no one grasps the Divine Secrets (الأسرار الإلهية) and Lights (الأنوار) they attained during that visitation. If even a fraction of those Lights were to manifest to the sight of those who do not possess this station (المقام), it would burn them and obliterate their existence. That concealment (الستر) was therefore a mercy to them. We have witnessed this in the Divine Gnosis (المعارف الإلهية) through direct witnessing (مشاهدة) when we visited Him with our hearts and deeds in Mecca, without which Umrah is not valid. As for visitation without naming it Umrah, it occurs for every visitor wherever he may be. Likewise, Hajj is a specific visitation, just as it is a specific intention. It is called *Umrah* (derived from *‘imāra*, meaning cultivation/inhabitation) because of the witnessing (الشهود) it contains, which cultivates the hearts.

[The Meaning of Expiation in Hajj and Umrah]

This is the meaning of expiation (التكفير) in this specific act. Expiation may also occur in other ways: it may conceal you from retribution (الانتقام) descending upon you due to the transgressions you committed. And there are some people for whom expiation is a concealment from transgressions afflicting them when they are directed towards them, sought by the desirous soul (النفس الشهوانية). In this case, the person is protected (معصوما) by this concealment, so the transgression has no ruling over him. These two meanings differ from the first. Some people combine all of these. In this world, all three rulings apply, but in the Hereafter, only two apply: the first concealment [of sins] and the concealment that prevents retribution from afflicting him.

[Concealment from Transgressions]

As for concealment from transgressions, it only occurs in this world due to the existence of obligation (التكليف). The Hereafter is not a place for obligation, except on the Day of Resurrection at the station of distinction (موطن التمييز) when they are called to prostrate. This is a call for distinction, not a call for obligation, except for the Hadith recorded by Al-Ḥumaydī in *Kitāb al-Muwāzana*, which is not authenticated. Because the command is associated with it, it resembles obligation, so they are rewarded for prostration like those who fulfilled obligations. Similarly, when the angels come to them from Allah with command and prohibition, it is not intended as obligation. This is their saying to the felicitous: "<<أَلَّا تَخافُوا ولا تَحْزَنُوا>>" (Fear not, nor grieve) – this is a prohibition – and "<<أَبْشِرُوا بِالْجَنَّةِ>>" (Receive good tidings of the Garden) – this is a command. This is not an obligation. Likewise, when they are commanded to prostrate, it is only for distinction and differentiation between those who prostrated purely for Allah and those who prostrated out of caution, hypocrisy, or seeking reputation, due to their common act of prostrating to Allah. Therefore, the resemblance occurred because they did not prostrate "<<مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ>>" (sincerely dedicating the religion to Him) as they were commanded. Thus, Allah distinguishes between them on the Day of Resurrection, just as He distinguishes between the criminals. The Exalted said: "<<وامْتازُوا الْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ>>" (And stand apart this Day, O you criminals).

(A Second Hadith Encouraging Following Up Hajj and Umrah)

Because both of them are an intention to visit the Ancient House of Allah.

Al-Nasā’ī recorded from Abdullah ibn Mas‘ūd that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Follow up Hajj and Umrah, for they dispel poverty (الفقر) and sins (الذنوب), just as the bellows (الكير) dispels the dross (خبث) of iron, gold, and silver."

And there is no reward for Hajj Mabrur short of Paradise. In the first Hadith, he made Umrah to Umrah, and likewise Hajj and *Birr*, the two premises. Here, he made Hajj and Umrah the two premises to yield another reward not granted by the first Hadith, which is the dispelling of poverty. Thus, when you combine these two acts of worship, a barrier is placed between you and your servanthood.

[The Servant is Distinguished from the Lord Only by Neediness]

There is nothing but a servant (عبد) and a Lord (رب). The servant is distinguished from the Lord only by neediness (الافتقار). When Allah removes his poverty, He clothes him in the garment of the Lordly Attribute (الصفة الربانية), granting him the power to say to a thing when he desires it, "Be, and it is" (<<كُنْ فَيَكُونُ>>). This is the secret of the existence of wealth (الغني) within poverty, and not everyone perceives it. For he does not say to a thing "Be, and it is" until he desires it (يشتهيه). For this reason, the Exalted said: "<<ولَكُمْ فِيها ما تَشْتَهِي أَنْفُسُكُمْ>>" (And therein you will have whatever your souls desire). He only sought what he did not possess, so that he might possess it out of the poverty that drove him to seek it, because his desire made him needy of it and called him to seek it. It is not the desired thing that seeks him, but he possesses the Lordly Attribute that necessitated for him the power to bring this desired thing into existence. So he said to it, "Be," out of poverty, yet with a Divine Attribute. Thus, this desired thing came into existence in its entity, and he took from it that for which he sought its existence. This is not the case concerning The Real (الحق), for Allah did not seek the formation of existing things out of need for them. Rather, things, in their state of contingent non-existence, seek their existence, being essentially needy (مفتقرة بالذات) of Allah, Who is their Creator, due to their inherent poverty. And in their existence from Allah, The Real accepted their request and brought them into existence for them and because of their request, not out of any need that arose in Him for them, because they are witnessed by the Exalted in their state of non-existence and their existence. The servant is not like that, for he lacks them sensually (حسا) in their state of non-existence, even if he does not lack them cognitively (علما), for were it not for his knowledge of them, he would not specify one thing for creation over another, or without another.

[The Servant is Composed of Two Essences: Meaning and Sense]

However, the servant is composed of two essences (ذاتين): meaning (معنى) and sense (حس), and this is his perfection. Unless the known thing exists for the sense, his perception of that thing is not perfected by the perfection of his essence. When he perceives it sensually after its existence, having already perceived it cognitively, his perception of the thing is perfected by his essence. His composition is the cause of his poverty toward that which he desired to exist, and his contingency is the cause of his poverty toward the One Who gives him preponderance. As for The Real, the Exalted, He is not composed, but is One. His perception of things, according to the realities of things in their state of non-existence and existence, is a single perception. Therefore, His bringing things into existence was not out of poverty, as it was for this created servant who possesses the attribute of The Real. This is an issue for which, if you gave your eye as a reward for its attainment, it would be little, for it is a slippery slope where many of the people of our path have stumbled and joined those whom Allah condemned in His Book for saying: "<<إِنَّ الله فَقِيرٌ>>" (Indeed, Allah is poor). This is the cause of that [misunderstanding]. The contingent being (الممكن) and the originated gnosis (المعرفة الحادثة) only came into existence for the perfection of the degree of Existence (رتبة الوجود) and the perfection of the degree of Gnosis (رتبة المعرفة), not for the perfection of Allah. Rather, He is Perfect in Himself, whether the world exists or not, and whether He is known by originated gnosis or not, just as, in reality, He is not known, and nothing contingent knows Him except Himself.

[The Sin Resembles the Tail and Has Two Noble Attributes from its Meaning]

As for the dispelling of sins (نفي الذنوب), it is related to the ruling of the Name *Al-Ākhir* (The Last), because sin (الذنب) is in the position of the tail (الذنب) relative to the head, coming after it, because the origin of existence is obedience. For the servant is compliant with creation, since he was told "Be," and he only came into existence obediently. Then, after that, transgression of the command, called sin, occurred to him. Thus, it resembles the tail in its posteriority. It is dispelled by the origin because it is an accidental matter (أمر عارض), and the accident has no permanence, even if it has a ruling during its existence, but it vanishes. This indicates that the ultimate outcome is felicity, if Allah wills, even after a time. Furthermore, the sin (الذنب) has two noble attributes derived from the meaning of the tail (الذنب). If a person knows them, he will know the status of sin with Allah. The tail of an animal has two noble attributes: it covers its nakedness (*‘awra*), and by moving it, it drives away flies. Likewise, sin contains Allah’s pardon (*‘afw*) and forgiveness (*maghfira*), and similar things that are not perceived, which it encompasses of the Divine Names, driving away from its possessor the harm of retribution (الانتقام) and accountability (المؤاخذة). These are like the flies that annoy the animal. Retribution only afflicts the *abtar* (الأبتر) who has no tail. The Exalted says: "<<إِنَّ شانِئَكَ هُوَ الْأَبْتَرُ>>" (Indeed, your reviler is the cut off/abbreviated), meaning he has no progeny, or he leaves no beneficial legacy after his death, just as

He, peace be upon him, said: "Or a righteous child who supplicates for him," whether a child or a grandchild, male or female.

By Allah’s saying to Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, that the one who brought shame upon you is the *abtar* (cut off), meaning he leaves no legacy. The *‘aqib* (legacy/tail) of a thing is its posterior part. That is why we said that sin is posterior, because it is at the rear of the animal, and without it, the animal is *abtar*. If you did not sin, Allah would bring a people who sin so that He may forgive them. He did not say "so that He may punish them." Thus, He gave precedence to forgiveness and made it the ruling. The very existence of sin is essentially for the sake of the forgiveness and accountability it entails, seeking the effect of the Names. Neither of the two opposing Names in ruling is more worthy than the other, but Mercy preceded Wrath in manifestation, leaving nothing that it did not encompass. And part of the physician's mercy toward the patient with gangrene is to inflict pain upon him by cutting off his leg. Understand this and pay attention.

[The Accountability of The Real Towards His Servants is Purification and Mercy]

The accountability (مؤاخذات) of The Real towards His servants in this world and the Hereafter is purification and mercy. The reminder of this is also that punishment (*‘iqāb*) only occurs for sin (*dhanb*). The word *‘uqūba* (punishment) necessitates delay from what precedes it; it comes *after* it. The punishment may find the sin in the place, or it may not, either because the person repented from it, or because the Names *Al-‘Afūw* (The Pardoner) and *Al-Ghafūr* (The Forgiving) sought the aid of the Name *Al-Raḥīm* (The Merciful), and the sin vanished. Thus, the punishment returns disappointed, and the name "sinner" vanishes from the transgressor, because he is only called a sinner while the sin (the transgression) stands with him. Forgiveness (الغفران) is related to the sin itself and what comes after it, because accountability and retribution are not certain to follow it. Thus, forgiveness does not come *after* it, and forgiveness is not called punishment. The reward for good is called *thawāb* (reward) because of its surging forth and haste, so it is present in the good deed itself for which it is deserved, because it comes from *thāba ilā al-shay’* (he rushed to the thing) when he surged toward it with haste and speed. For this reason, He said: "<<سارِعُوا إِلى‏ مَغْفِرَةٍ من رَبِّكُمْ>>" (Hasten to forgiveness from your Lord).
And He said: "<<يُسارِعُونَ في الْخَيْراتِ وهُمْ لَها سابِقُونَ>>" (They hasten to good deeds, and they are foremost in them). He made the hastening *in* and *to* good deeds and *to* forgiveness. One is only foremost to it through sins and seeking forgiveness, for forgiveness only applies to a sin, even if it sometimes conceals the servant from sins afflicting him (this is the protected/infallible one, *al-ma‘ṣūm* and *al-maḥfūẓ*). Thus, it has two rulings concerning the servant: erasing the sin by concealing him from punishment, or infallibility and protection. It does not apply to a penitent person, for the penitent has no sin, as repentance removes it. Thus, forgiveness only applies to sinners while they are sinners and not penitent. Therein its ruling appears. This is a spiritual taste (ذوق) unlike anything that has touched your heart before, and it is one of Allah’s hidden secrets concerning His servants in the ruling of His Beautiful Names. Only the People of Allah (أهل الله) understand this through witnessing (شهودا). Such a matter is called *al-taḍmīn* (implication). For He commanded hastening to forgiveness, but He did not command hastening to sin. Since pardon and forgiveness require sin, and He commanded hastening to forgiveness, He is commanded to do that by which forgiveness may appear. That without which an obligation cannot be attained is itself obligatory, but from the perspective of it being an act, not from the perspective of it being a ruling. He concealed the mention of sin here and mentioned forgiveness because of His saying: "<<إِنَّ الله لا يَأْمُرُ بِالْفَحْشاءِ>>" (Indeed, Allah does not command immorality). Command is one of the categories of speech. So He did not command sins; rather, He commanded hastening and speeding to good deeds and to forgiveness. Understand this.

[The Bellows Dispels the Dross of Metallic Bodies]

As for the analogy of the bellows dispelling the dross (*khabath*) of iron, silver, and gold, this dross is what adhered to these bodies in the mines from their natural origin. They sought the aid of fire to remove it, and they sought the aid of air to ignite the fire, and they sought the aid of the bellows to move the air. Thus, the dross was only dispelled through two premises: fire and air. Were it not for the existence of these two forces, the cognitive (العلمية) and the operative (العملية), this dross would not have been removed.

[The Secrets of Allah in Things are Innumerable]

We have already discussed Hajj Mabrur, although it has another meaning here that is not the one previously mentioned. However, we suffice with the first one for fear of undue length, for the secrets of Allah in things are innumerable. Rather, in every state, something new sparks in the hearts of the people of hearts (أصحاب القلوب) that only Allah knows. The common people do not know this. For this reason, the elite among Allah’s servants say that there is no repetition (تكرار) in the Divine Vastness (الاتساع الإلهي). Rather, the similitudes veil the hearts from this perception with their forms, so the common people imagine repetition. But Allah is "<<واسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ>>" (Vast, All-Knowing). Whoever realizes the existence of this Name, *Al-Wāsi‘*, does not speak of repetition. "<<بَلْ هُمْ في لَبْسٍ من خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ>>" (Rather, they are in confusion concerning a new creation).

(A Third Hadith on the Chapter of Visiting the House, May Allah Honor It)

Muslim recorded from Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever visits this House and neither engages in foul talk (رفث) nor commits transgression (فسق) returns as the day his mother gave birth to him."

In the wording of Al-Bukhārī from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever performs Hajj for Allah and neither engages in foul talk nor commits transgression..."

[Birth is an Exit from Constriction to Spaciousness]

Know that the day the newborn emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges from constriction (الضيق) to spaciousness (السعة) without doubt, and from darkness to light. Spaciousness is the Mercy of Allah, which "<<وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْ‏ءٍ>>" (encompasses everything).
